column4: Hi all. I have an ISO file I want to burn using the Live CD, however when I try to eject the Live CD, I can't. I right click on the drive and go to Eject but it tells me there's probably no media...
I've tried eject /dev/cdrom which does work, however inserting a blank doesn't detect so I can't proceed
You can't eject the LiveCD while using it to run the system.
oh. So is there anything I can do to get this ISO burned?
Burn it with the host OS you have running, or if you are booted into the LiveCD and trying to burn the ISO there, use a different drive than you have the LiveCD in
The host OS is fried. The ISO is a backup of all of the data that I need. The system is a laptop with only one burner... so I guess that means I can't do anything, right?
Use the liveCD to make a liveUSB image
No USB drive. Just a laptop and a live CD right now ;)
If your laptop can boot off of a usb drive, then you can boot off of the usb drive and use the cd drive to burn
What is the host OS you are trying to fix?
Windows XP. I think a virus took out the system files. I've tried everything (recovery CDs, live Windows CDs, etc), but nothing, so I've decided to start from scratch.
What exactly are you trying to do? You can just reinstall windows from the install CD.
Alternatively, you could actually instal Ubuntu on the laptop, and in the installer, tell it to use the free space on the windows partition. It will create a small area and install ubuntu on that
I have a lot of work I need to backup, and Windows no longer boots, hence why I was hoping I could use the Ubuntu live CD to back them up first, then reinstall Windows.
and then  you can boot into that install and burn whatever data you need
I had no idea you could do that! That sounds like exactly what I need
That will keep your windows files, just use the free space on the drive to make a small install of ubuntu
